Reviews.Title: “Relatively big room, attached to shopping mall with Spanish brands, away from downtown”
Reviews.Author: CY C
Reviews.Content: Pros: Room is rather big. Free internet. Attached to a shopping malls with Zara, Mango, Massimo Dutti, Bershka etc. Starbucks right across the hotel. Cons: 20-mins walk to the nearest metro although there is a bus stop next to the hotel heading to Plaza Catalunya etc and it's faster to reach downtown by bus than by train. Poor selection of breakfast at EUR 16 per pax.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, attached to mall, easy to get around Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: SJofMexico
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Husa L'illa for five nights. Overall a good experience. Would have been great if the bed were a bit more comfortable and the TV was not so old and with so few channels. SERVICE - No complaints whatsoever. Lovely. A couple of very brief issues with wireless internet access were easily resolved with a quick call to the front desk. ROOM - Spacious, basic accommodation. Very nice bathroom (though clearly the lighting was done by a man - haha!) The bed was a bit uncomfortable for me - I prefer a softer mattress than this. After the first night, I took the sofa cushion and put it under the fitted sheet for added softness. The television was VERY old (probably late 1980s) and the remote did not work, plus I think there were a total of about 15 channels and only CNN in English. I brought my iPad so this was no big deal, but I thought it was worth mentioning anyway. BREAKFAST - A nice buffet, good coffee, open from 7:00-11:00 AM (included). LOCATION - Attached to a nice little shopping mall. Outside the center of town, but I found it very easy to get around Barcelona. I bought a 4-day unlimited pass for the Metro for around $25 Euros. Several people mentioned that they thought the hotel was too far from the subway stop, but I disagree. You can get to the subway from the hotel by turning left on your way out the door and walking about 10 minutes... OR (much easier/faster), go outside the hotel and a little to your right - southeast - and just across the street (well, actually halfway across the street) on your right there is a stop for the Tram. Get on the Tram going toward the Maria Cristina Metro stop. DINING NEARBY - Obviously there are a million great places to eat in Barcelona, but sometimes you are looking for something close to the hotel. I had dinner one evening at Piscolabis and it was quite good - just walk outside the hotel and take a left; walk about 5 minutes and it is right there next to the Starbucks. Good tapas, nice wine. I also had lunch one afternoon at the mall and it was not bad at all - just walk outside the hotel and take a sharp left turn into the mall; through the walkway at the back there are several little cafes with decent food and good people-watching.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and good service, but not much else to recommend it”
Reviews.Author: ln2inSegovia
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for work for 2 nights in March. The hotel is fine, but has little to recommend it. As people have mentioned: once you get beyond the lobby everything is really dated, chipped, and a little tired. The lobby isn't any great shakes either, but it is a fresher looking than the rest of the hotel. I didn't try the breakfast, so I don't know if it any better (or if it is even in the price of the room). For me, the worst was that it was impossible to get fresh air anywhere. In the hotel rooms, the windows are locked shut. And, the air conditioner made a lot of noise, but produced very little air. In the conference room, they apparently couldn't cool it down (with the air conditioner), so they resorted to opening the one door into the room (out onto the non-useable). This still didn't provide much relief. Furthermore, the hotel is short hike to the closest subway station (maybe a 10-15 minute walk). It's not far, but with bags etc, it's too far for comfort. Lastly, I didn't compare with other hotels, but 108/night seemed a little steep for what you got (although I think you can get internet deals for as low as 88/night - but am not positive). That being said, there are some aspects that could recommend it depending on what you are looking for: (i) the rooms are huge as is the bed, and the bathroom is old-school nice (marble walls, spacious, highish ceilings) - although of course, dated (ii) the rooms are quite clean. Although tired and dingy-looking, the cleaning service is thorough (even fully making the bed the next day - often I find hotels don't fully make (e.g., tuck in the sheets completely)) (iii) the front desk tries to be accommodating - e.g., the second night we couldn't bear the stuffy room, so my husband begged that they open the window - and so they came with the key and after we promised not to jump or throw things out the window, they opened it... and it was luxurious. (iv) the location is interesting and could be very good under certain conditions. If you're not familiar with Barcelona, the hotel is a pretty far outside of the main tourist areas (with the exception of Camp Nou - which is right down the street). To get to the Rambla you have to walk to the subway station (10-15 minutes) and then take the Line 3 for 7-9 stops (15 minutes) to get to the Rambla. However, it IS IN the heart (I mean literally in the middle) of a shopping complex that extends for several blocks. If you like to shop, there's a lot there (check the website for the list of stores: http://www.lilla.com/ca/). Furthermore, if you have kids this could be a great solution - as there is decent playground and open space behind the hotel. It has a smallish playground, a basketball court, and an AWESOME set of trampolines (fee-based) for kids. Furthermore, there appeared to be a gym of some sorts with sports like tennis, etc. there as well. Lastly, if you like to run, the opposite side of the street seems to be the main thoroughfare for runners(bikers) in the am. The blocks are long, the sidewalks are flat and wide (and there's a bike path), and in the morning it is in the sun. So, it looked like a good city run option (although I'm sure running down by the water is probably nicer :)). Furthermore, the area has a number of food options - not high end or particularly notable, but easy (many are child-friendly) and with decent food. I probably wouldn't stay here again, but if I wanted to stay in the area, I might consider it (although there is a Marriott reopening down the street and there is an NH right behind, so there might be better options).

Reviews.Title: “Outdated without amenities”
Reviews.Author: naga78
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at Husa L'illa for 5 nights. The rooms are definitely outdated (tvs are old, small CRTs). The free wireless internet only worked sometimes and when it worked was very slow. There was no iron in the room and when I asked for one, they said that they didn't have one (for the entire hotel!) and that they would have it pressed for me. They didn't tell me that it would cost $8 just to iron each shirt. So I was definitely surprised when there was a $40 charge at check out for pressing 5 shirts. Especially since I could have done it myself in ~15 min. The only pro is that the rooms were clean. But I agree with other reviewers, you can do much better at another hotel for the price.

Reviews.Title: “A cofortable hotel, On a big mall”
Reviews.Author: Tzabar59
Reviews.Content: Two things are most important for me: Rooms and Location. The rooms in Husa L'illa are BIG ROOMS. Very comfortable. Very neat. The Lobby is Small, But the dining room is big and breakfasts are nice. The locatiob is quite far from the underground station (15 minutes - regular walk). The staff is very helpful. 5 stars for the rooms. 2 stars for location. 4 stars for service. 1 star for the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “not in center, smokey room, you can do better”
Reviews.Author: uri117
Reviews.Content: although next to a mall, and not to far from some coffey shops and restaurants the hotel is about 45 min. walk to the center (catalunya placa), there is an underground station about 10 min. walk. the rooms are big and clean but our room had a really nasty smell of smoke (you cant open the window!). they tried to spray it but it didnt really work. an averegge minus 3 star hotel. summerize it, go to a different hotel!

Reviews.Title: “It's OK but not exciting”
Reviews.Author: Mandy C
Reviews.Content: We travelled with our two children 5 and 9 and shared a room with a sofa bed for the children which was fine. Room very spacious but quite simple and practical. I felt breakfast was more geared towards other cultural palates. This hotel was ok for one night but if you are looking for something a bit different and a pool try the Acevi Villarroel.

Reviews.Title: “ok for short business trips”
Reviews.Author: zoznam
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 2 nights for a business trip. The rooms and interior look a bit like done in the eighties, but clean. Service at reception was very friendly, helpful and welcoming - and helped me with finding a gym nearby (DiR, quite pricey but ok) I had booked a non-smoking room, and there was no smell inside the room - but in the hallway. Very irritating when you opened the door. And an ashtray in the room ... Beds were a bit hard, and the room pretty spartanic, windows could not be opened. But the rooms were clean, bath very spacious, wifi worked well, and the room was huge. Lots of space, so I felt very well there. Would book it again for a short business trip.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel (and a lucky upgrade!)”
Reviews.Author: mdarsigny
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hussa L'Illa in May 2010. We initially booked at the Hussa Internacional to have a room close to Las Ramblas but due to unfortunate circumstances (i.e.: guests being too drunk to leave the hotel...) we were upgraded to Hussa L'illa at no charges (Internacional is 1 star, L'Illa is 4 stars....). Although Hussa L'Illa is located in a place more convenient for locals or business people rather than tourist, it is still located in a great neighborhood, especially if you like shopping. It is located at 5-10 minutes walk from the Maria Cristina or the Entenca metro stations. The hotel rooms are very large for European hotel rooms (usually, hotel rooms are larger in North America than Europe, but not for this hotel!). We had a twin room & it had also a couch & a desk. Everything was really clean. The staff either at both Hussa's hotel we went (Internacional & L'illa) were extremely helpfull.

Reviews.Title: “It was past Midnight and they Had a Room!”
Reviews.Author: ChristinaB5
Reviews.Content: EXCELLENT - Loved the breakfast - coffee was great - staff wonderful, a really good stay

Reviews.Title: “Good location but fails to impress”
Reviews.Author: bhromonpagol
Reviews.Content: Good location and in the same block as the L'Illa shopping mall. However the rooms and the service fails to impress. The breakfast is very ordinary and rooms are average. Facilities are not like other 4 start properties

Reviews.Title: “Nice location - bad service”
Reviews.Author: irafique
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 6 days in july. Good things: - Nice location - Reasonable price - Big room - Good shopping area Bad things: - A bit noicy from the backside of hotel - A bit far from Maria Christina metro station - Not so freindly personal - Charged for stuff in minibar, which we didn't use - No answer on complaints - Not possible to borrow iron, you have to deliver clothes I only give it 2-stars because we had to for stuff in minibar even we didn't consume anything. I wrote a complaint, but the hotel didn't even answer. We didn't use the restaurant in the hotel, as the L'illa center is very close, and there is lot of places to eat.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Traveller1050
Reviews.Content: The Lilla Husa is an excellent 4 star hotel. It is located on the diagonal st (close to the Maria Christina metro station). From here it was a short ride to all the major attractions. The hotel itself was great. Quiet, large and clean room. The breakfast was also better than I had expected. Lots of options- pastries, meat, cereal, fruit and eggs. The staff was very helpful. Overall a great option for a hotel a little out of the main tourist areas.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location for shops”
Reviews.Author: simmoinspain
Reviews.Content: Very good location for the shopping centre. 7 minute walk to metro. The rooms were clean and friendly staff but we were on the 4th floor and it was still noisy outside. The avda diagonal is a very busy road and the night club nearby did not help either when they decide to leave in the early hours. But the main problem was they charge 32€ a night for parking which is crazy so we did not use them for parking our car which was very inconvenient.

Reviews.Title: “Unfriendly!”
Reviews.Author: Mucker123
Reviews.Content: Rooms are big, location not good. But the staff....! Unfriendly is hardly the correct term for them. We were made to feel particularly unwelcome. Certainly wouldn't consider it again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: zima1980
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel. Huge rooms and hallways. Nice that they have a parking directly below the hotel, but it is quite expensive. Small disadvantages that rooms have no balcony and smell like cigarettes (and I am a smoker).

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: mkle
Reviews.Content: The hotel rooms are hugh and clean but you can see that the hotel is quite old by the softness of the matresses, television and the bath room. The male staff could be a little more friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tim L
Reviews.Content: Admittedly not very close to the tourist centre of Barcelona, but if like us your business was more local to this area then this is a great hotel- escpecially if you can get a room at a discounted price.

Reviews.Title: “Untitled review”
Reviews.Author: DGF69
Reviews.Content: The bedroom and bathroom are huge! And they're kept clean. Although the hotel is a good bit away from the city centre, La Ramble etc., it has good transport links - it's on a night bus route. A good place to base yourself if you're staying for a few days, but not if it's a weekend and you want to stagger back to your room after a night on the beer in the city centre! It's close to the Nou Camp stadium, if footie tickles your fancy.

Reviews.Title: “Dingy and Tired”
Reviews.Author: Williams86
Reviews.Content: Two words: photos lie. I just returned from staying at the Husa L'illa Hotel in Barcelona and came away disappointed. DO NOT BELIEVE EXPEDIA RATINGS. This is NOT a four-star hotel. This is the second time I have booked a room via Expedia and have been disappointed. A three-star for this hotel is pushing it. I am sure in its day, the hotel was considered a luxuary hotel, but this hotel has seen better days. The hotel is tired and dingy and so is the staff (except for one young gentelman with a pony tail who was very eager to answer questions), the other older gentleman did not seem like they wanted to be there. They did not go above the simple yes and no questions. When I asked if the hotel had a fitness center, I was told no but there was one a few blocks away. When I got to the fiteness center, I was told I needed to come with a member or have the hotel give me a pass. This was never offered to me when inquiring about the gym. Needless to say, I had to go back and ask for a pass, which cost $15.00 and return to the gym. Not a big deal, but that's the difference between a good hotel and a not-so-good-hotel--the details. Also, since guest can SMOKE anywhere they please, the hallways and room have an antiseptic smell to cover up the odor of an ashtray. The windows in the hotel do not open so there is no possibity for fresh air. As for breakfast (not included), you are better off going to Starbucks across the street. Not worth the money. I will say, the location is great and you are very close to the Metro, which is very easy to use. The last time I was in Barcelona, I stay in the Ramla area. Too much a circus for me. This is a much better location and only four or five stops on the Metro. The Mall next store offers a lot of diversion and a few eating establishments. Make sure you go to the lower level where there are many eateries. The Hilton Barelona is only one block away and it looks very nice. I had a drink at the bar. Husa L'ills doesn't have a bar and only one computer which you pay to use by the minutes. I would guess that the Hilton is more money, but as the saying goes, you get what you pay for. A lesson learned.

Reviews.Title: “I have never been in a better one.”
Reviews.Author: Ramin-Raiszadeh
Reviews.Content: Every thing was perfect. Huge rooms. Excellent airconditioning and house keeping. Very attractive location, specially for women (A lovely shopping centre anjacent). Very clean. And we paid just around 65 pounds per night for a twin bedroom in a summer special offer. I booked it through expedia.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First Class Hotel, as a regular visitor to various European Hotels this rates right up there, the rooms were spacious and very clean, the staff were very friendly. Although primarily a business hotel, I stayed with my young child and couldn't have asked for better/friendlier service. The shower broke on one occasion and it was repaired within 15 minutes! Very pleasant location, plenty to do in the area, shopping etc. even a small fairground at the rear. Would definetly stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location for shopping”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very clean, rooms are spacious and ours on the fifth floor had great views over the city. Service is excellent. Breakfast varied and plentiful. Lovely upmarket shopping centre under the hotel. About an hour to walk to the Ramblas, so we took taxis or the tube. I would definitely use this hotel again when staying in Barcelona.
